items.description: Tidal Thames riverside from Putney Bridge to Teddington Weir
items.eaAreaName: Kent, South London and East Sussex

floodArea.county: Greater London, Hammersmith and Fulham, Hounslow, Richmond upon Thames, Wandsworth

items.message:
River levels are expected to be high as a result of spring tides.

The forecast high tide at Richmond will be 4.60 mAOD at 06:15 on 26/08/21.

Flooding of low-lying roads and footpaths is expected, which may exist for one to two hours either side of high tide. Flooding of properties is not expected.

We believe there is a possibility of flooding for Putney Embankment (SW15), Chiswick Mall and Strand on the Green (W4), Thames Bank at Mortlake (SW14), Ranelagh Drive (TW1), Friars Lane and Water Lane (TW9), Riverside and The Embankment at Twickenham, and the Towpath below Teddington Lock. 

Astronomical tide levels are falling. The river flow at Teddington Weir is low for this time of year at 20 cubic metres per second and is due to rise slightly. We anticipate the flows to remain low for the next few days.

We are closely monitoring the situation.

This message will be updated by 15:00 on 26/08/21, or as the situation changes.

items.description: North Sea coast at Withernsea, Easington and Kilnsea
items.message: This Flood Alert has been issued due to overtopping waves and spray that are expected as a result of spring tides and strengthening winds. The area of particular concern is Spurn Road, where overtopping waves and spray are expected between 07:30 and 09:15 hours BST on Thursday 26/08/2021. Areas most at risk are low lying land and roads. We are not expecting these coastal conditions to continue on the following tide. Our incident response staff are closely monitoring the forecast. Please be careful along beaches, promenades, coastal footpaths and roads as large waves and sea spray could be dangerous. This message will be updated by 09:30 on Thursday morning, or as the situation changes.

items.description: Humber estuary from Spurn Point to Winestead Outfall
items.message: This Flood Alert has been issued due to overtopping waves and spray that are expected as a result of spring tides and strengthening winds. The area of particular concern is Kilnsea Village, where overtopping waves and spray are expected between 07:45 and 09:15 hours BST on Thursday 26/08/2021. Areas most at risk are low lying land and roads. We are not expecting these coastal conditions to continue on the following tide. Our incident response staff are closely monitoring the forecast. Please be careful along beaches, promenades, coastal footpaths and roads as large waves and sea spray could be dangerous. This message will be updated by 09:30 on Thursday morning, or as the situation changes.
